OBR

Package obr

Interface Summary
DecidableClassCheck Interface for functions checking if a graph of rule dependencies or a subset of this graph belongs to a concrete decidable class.
 

Class Summary
Atom Represents an atom.
Note that instances of this class can be returned by the atom conjunction class, but this will imply the atom creation.
AtomConjunction Represents a conjunction of atoms.
AtomicHypothesisCheck Checks if all rules in the GRD or in one of its strongly connected components satisfy the atomic-hypothesis property.
AtomicRule Represents an atomic rule.
A rule is an atom conjunction which adds the notions of "body" and "head".
An atomic rule contains only one atom in its head.
DecidableClassLabel Label for a decidable class check.
DisconnectedCheck Checks if a set of rules satisfies the disconnected property.
I.e., if all rules have a frontier of size 0.
DomainRestrictedCheck Checks if a set of rules satisfies the domain-restricted property.
DTGParser This class provides static functions to parse a single rule from its string representation, or a full set of rules from a file.
FrontierGuardedCheck  
FrontierOneCheck Checks if a set of rules satisfies the frontier-1 property.
I.e., if all rules have a frontier of size 1.
GraphPositionDependencies Represents the graph of position dependencies corresponding to a GRD or to one of its strongly connected components.
The graph maintains a hash map to find quickly the vertex corresponding to a predicate and its position.
GraphRuleDependencies Unsecure : if a vertex already in the graph is added once again, it may produce strange behaviour if an edge is added manually it may produce errors
GRDAnalyser Analyse a graph of rule dependencies to determine if it belongs to decidable class.
Furthermore, the GRDAnalyser will check the strongly connected components of the GRD.
GuardedCheck  
Predicate Represents a predicate with its label and its arity.
RangeRestrictedCheck Checks if a set of rules satisfies the range-restricted property.
I.e., if there is no existential variables.
StickyCheck Checks if a set of rules satisfies the stickiness property.
Term A term may be either a variable or a constant.
A constant is surround by simple quotes.
WeaklyAcyclicCheck Checks if a set of rules satisfies the weakly-acyclic property.
WeaklyStickyCheck Checks if a set of rules satisfies the weakly-stickiness property.
 

Exception Summary
ExtensionFailureException Exception thrown by the extension algorithm if failure.
MarkFailureException Exception thrown by the marking process of some concrete class checks when it fails.
UnrecognizedStringFormatException Exception thrown whenever a string is not recognized.
